TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Int32Rect extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Describes the width, height, and location of an integer rectangle.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or ``` ## XAML Values *X* The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. *Y* The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. *Width* The width of the rectangle. *Height* The height of the rectangle. ## XAML Text Usage You can also use whitespace instead of commas to delimit values. Whitespace can also be used with a comma delimited value set.

MemberSignature.Value: public Int32Rect (int x, int y, int width, int height);

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X%2A> of the new instance which specifies the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y%2A> of the new instance which specifies the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width%2A> of the new instance which specifies the width of the rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height%2A> of the new instance which specifies the height of the rectangle.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of an with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Y%2A> coordinates and the specified <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Int32Rect.Height%2A>.
Gets the empty rectangle, a special value that represents a rectangle with no position or area.
Docs.value: An empty rectangle with no position or area.
